results.title: A novel mechanism involved in 5-hydroxytryptamine-induced nociception: the indirect activation of primary afferents.
results.text_hl: -injected @CHEMICAL_Dopamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004298 @@@dopamine@@@ also produced a dose-dependent @<m>DISEASE_Nociceptive_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D059226 @@@nociceptive@@@ behavior that was significantly reduced by both @CHEMICAL_SCH_23390 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C534628 @@@SCH 23390@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Tambeli CH, Oliveira MC, Clemente JT, Pelegrini-da-Silva A, Parada CA. A novel mechanism involved in 5-hydroxytryptamine-induced nociception: the indirect activation of primary afferents. Neuroscience. 2006 Sep 1;141(3):1517-24. PMID: 16750893
